alert.note: Alert for Washington (Rhode Island) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 2:28AM EST until January 12 at 2:42AM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Connecticut...Rhode Island...Massachusetts... Farmington River At Unionville affecting Hartford County. Wood River At Hope Valley affecting Washington County. Blackstone River At Woonsocket affecting Providence and Worcester Counties. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Rhode Island... Pawtuxet River At Cranston affecting Kent and Providence Counties. .Heavy rain will fall on a deep primed snowpack leading to the melt increasing. Flows in rivers will increase quickly and reach critical levels. For the Farmington River...including Unionville, Simsbury, Tariffville...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Blackstone River...including Woonsocket...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Pawtuxet River...including Scituate Reservoir, Cranston... Major flooding is forecast. For the Wood River...including Hope Valley...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wood River at Hope Valley. * WHEN...From this morning to early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, In Richmond, the Wood River blocks sections of Tall Timbers Drive, Leroy Drive, Wood River Circle and Wood River Drive. Dow Field off of Main Street in Hopkinton is substantially flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:15 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 3.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 5.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this morning to a crest of 6.8 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 5.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 230 PM EST.
